content: I need to know if anyone can relate or understand what it is like to be deployed and cheat on a boyfriend/girlfriend. I have been searching and searching online for something about female soldiers cheating during deployment and everything is always about the "male" soldier and how he cheated or how his lady cheated. I am currently deployed to Iraq and am the quintessential 'FOBIT.' Without going into too much detail I want to know if there is anyone out there who might be able to relate to what it is like to in a loving supportive relationship back at home, but cheated while deployed because the temptation is relentless. (Especially if you are a very attractive female.) Before anyone jumps to typical judgment, let me pose a question in the form of a thought I have... I try to think what it might be like if the tables were turned. If my boyfriend were here and there were some other men, but THOUSANDS of women. Not to mention, the majority of them would be young, in shape and extremely attractive. And everywhere he went they looked at him like he was a god. Essentially throwing themselves at him and willing to do whatever he wanted whenever he wanted it. The attention would be relentless, every day, every hour, ever where you went. To escape and prevent it if you wanted to, you would have to hold yourself up in your room, never eat, never go to the gym or never go to work. How long do you think he could resist?

To escape and prevent it if you wanted to, you would have to hold yourself up in your room, never eat, never go to the gym or never go to work. How long do you think he could resist?
title: Am I the only unfaithful female soldier in Iraq?

content: Back in my younger days when I was actually tolerable to look at, I worked in the FL Keys for the USCG. Off duty, I worked security at a local resort/bar. Girls hit on me all the time while my fiance was back in NH. It wasn't hard to say no because I was so in love with my gal back home. You're an adult, you probably know if it was wrong or not. I wouldn't try looking to what others do for justification. You're the one looking back at you in the mirror. Integrity: doing what's right even when noone is watching. Don Proud father of a US Marine Just to add....if you are that hot to look at and I am not saying you aren't, chances are that your boyfriend is also good looking. How's he holding up on the relationship back home? If he is being faithful with all the babes back in the U.S., then I don't see you finding any way to feel good about things about now.

content: A Mexican wood****** and a Canadian wood****** were in Mexico arguing about which place had the toughest trees. The Mexican wood****** claimed Mexico had a tree that no wood****** could peck. The Canadian wood****** accepted his challenge and promptly pecked a hole in the tree with no problem. The Mexican wood****** was amazed. The Canadian wood****** then challenged the Mexican wood****** to peck a tree in Canada that was absolutely 'impeckable' (a term frequently used by wood******s ). The Mexican wood****** expressed confidence that he could do it and accepted the challenge. The two flew to Canada where the Mexican wood****** successfully pecked the so-called 'impeckable' tree almost without breaking a sweat. Both wood******s were now terribly confused. How is it that the Canadian wood****** was able to peck the Mexican tree and the Mexican wood****** was able to peck the Canadian tree, yet neither was able to peck the tree in their own country? After much wood****** pondering, they both came to the same conclusion:.....Apparently, your ****** gets harder when you're away from home.

content: I need to know if anyone can relate or understand what it is like to be deployed and cheat on a boyfriend/girlfriend. I have been searching and searching online for something about female soldiers cheating during deployment and everything is always about the "male" soldier and how he cheated or how his lady cheated. I am currently deployed to Iraq and am the quintessential 'FOBIT.' Without going into too much detail I want to know if there is anyone out there who might be able to relate to what it is like to in a loving supportive relationship back at home, but cheated while deployed because the temptation is relentless. (Especially if you are a very attractive female.) Before anyone jumps to typical judgment, let me pose a question in the form of a thought I have... I try to think what it might be like if the tables were turned. If my boyfriend were here and there were some other men, but THOUSANDS of women. Not to mention, the majority of them would be young, in shape and extremely attractive. And everywhere he went they looked at him like he was a god. Essentially throwing themselves at him and willing to do whatever he wanted whenever he wanted it. The attention would be relentless, every day, every hour, ever where you went. To escape and prevent it if you wanted to, you would have to hold yourself up in your room, never eat, never go to the gym or never go to work. How long do you think he could resist?

content: Back in my younger days when I was actually tolerable to look at, I worked in the FL Keys for the USCG. Off duty, I worked security at a local resort/bar. Girls hit on me all the time while my fiance was back in NH. It wasn't hard to say no because I was so in love with my gal back home. You're an adult, you probably know if it was wrong or not. I wouldn't try looking to what others do for justification. You're the one looking back at you in the mirror. Integrity: doing what's right even when noone is watching. Don Proud father of a US Marine Just to add....if you are that hot to look at and I am not saying you aren't, chances are that your boyfriend is also good looking. How's he holding up on the relationship back home? If he is being faithful with all the babes back in the U.S., then I don't see you finding any way to feel good about things about now.

You'll have to deal with what ever comes of this. not exactly sure what your looking for but i think you should start with being honest to the man back home. Can't say if he'll stay or leave. But he deserves to know so the two of you can decide how to move on from this. even if its moving on apart. content: A Mexican wood****** and a Canadian wood****** were in Mexico arguing about which place had the toughest trees. The Mexican wood****** claimed Mexico had a tree that no wood****** could peck. The Canadian wood****** accepted his challenge and promptly pecked a hole in the tree with no problem. The Mexican wood****** was amazed. The Canadian wood****** then challenged the Mexican wood****** to peck a tree in Canada that was absolutely 'impeckable' (a term frequently used by wood******s ). The Mexican wood****** expressed confidence that he could do it and accepted the challenge. The two flew to Canada where the Mexican wood****** successfully pecked the so-called 'impeckable' tree almost without breaking a sweat. Both wood******s were now terribly confused. How is it that the Canadian wood****** was able to peck the Mexican tree and the Mexican wood****** was able to peck the Canadian tree, yet neither was able to peck the tree in their own country? After much wood****** pondering, they both came to the same conclusion:.....Apparently, your ****** gets harder when you're away from home.
